citations.narrative:
Disposition records for two ferrets named Edison and Tesla were not available at time of inspection. Availability of
required records at time of inspection is essential to be able to assess care and welfare of animals under control of
licensee. The licensee must maintain disposition records for regulated animals for one year after disposition.
Correct by 13 April 2023.

A contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to provide
humane handling of animals during emergent events. Correct by developing a complete contingency plan tailored to the
facility and animals on hand.
Correct by 27 April 2023.

The timothy hay feed for the two adult guinea pigs was stored on the floor of the teaching animal room in an open bag.
Food stored in such a manner can become spoiled or contaminated by vermin and thus be detrimental to animal health.
The licensee must store supplies of food and bedding in a way that adequately protects against spoilage, deterioration
and vermin infestation. Food supplies shall be stored in containers with tightly fitting lids or covers. Correct by storing
food appropriately such as opened bags in a container with a tightly fitting lid.
Correct by 13 April 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Disposition records for two ferrets named Edison and Tesla were not available at time of inspection.  Availability of 
required records at time of inspection is essential to be able to assess care and welfare of animals under control of 
licensee.  The licensee must maintain disposition records for regulated animals for one year after disposition.  
Correct by 13 April 2023. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to provide 
humane handling of animals during emergent events. Correct by developing a complete contingency plan tailored to the 
facility and animals on hand. 
Correct by 27 April 2023. 
3.25(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The timothy hay feed for the two adult guinea pigs was stored on the floor of the teaching animal room in an open bag.  
Food stored in such a manner can become spoiled or contaminated by vermin and thus be detrimental to animal health.  
The licensee must store supplies of food and bedding in a way that adequately protects against spoilage, deterioration

and vermin infestation.  Food supplies shall be stored in containers with tightly fitting lids or covers.  Correct by storing 
food appropriately such as opened bags in a container with a tightly fitting lid. 
Correct by 13 April 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
